{"step_by_step_thinking": "Prucalopride is a medication used for the treatment of chronic constipation. It works by stimulating the muscles in the wall of the gut to increase bowel movements. This is achieved by its action as a selective serotonin receptor agonist. Specifically, it targets the 5HT4 receptors, not the 5HT2b or 5HT1a receptors.", "answer_choice": "A"}
